content: This cuts close to the bone. I am on book 3 of a trilogy that spans from the 1970s to the present. The first was easy — in the 1970s phones in Manila were hard to come by & often out of order. The 2nd — just for the exercise — spanned land-line (& answering service) to beeper to early cell-phone days. But the one I’m working on now (the one that helps keep me patient with you & Steward & the fairies) is in the present — with smart phones, iPads & all. Shit man! Anybody can tell anyone anything at anytime. Drama’s damned hard when you have to figure out non-stupid ways of keeping characters ignorant.
